thread.title: Blitzboks cruise into Sydney Sevens final | Sport24
thread.title_full: Blitzboks cruise into Sydney Sevens final | Sport24

title: Blitzboks cruise into Sydney Sevens final | Sport24
text:
Blitzboks cruise into Sydney Sevens final 2017-02-05 07:43 Argentina down Canada to open America's event 
Cape Town - A dominant display by the Blitzboks saw them cruise into the finals of the Sydney Sevens by downing home favourites Australia 26-12 in a semi-final encounter. 
Tries by Kwagga Smith (2), Seabelo Senatla and Chris Dry saw the Blitzboks home in a game where Australian ill discipline cost them dearly. The home side were given two yellow cards in the space of a minute with Mick Adams and James Stannard sent to the sidelines for a dangerous tackle and a trip respectively. 
Australia were in the contest up until that point and had scored through Tim Anstee to keep within striking distance of the Blitzboks. 
Earlier the HSBC World Sevens Series leaders proved too strong for a game USA side in a quarter-finals, running out 21-10 winners. 
They will now face England in the final of the tournament and will be looking for revenge after losing to their opponents in pool match on Saturday.
